meanings.definition: The basic monetary unit of France before the adoption of the euro.
meanings.sent1: In the past, people in France used the franc to buy things.
meanings.sent2: I found an old coin that was a franc from France.
meanings.sent3: Why did the pig save up so many francs? To buy a fancy truffle!
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like a shiny franc, brightening up the room.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the franc dropping into the piggy bank was music to his ears.

meanings.definition: A French coin worth one franc.
meanings.sent1: I found a franc on the street and used it to buy a candy bar.
meanings.sent2: Back in the day, a franc could buy you a loaf of bread.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel buried the franc in the garden, thinking it was a nut.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was like a jingling franc, spreading joy around.
meanings.sent5: The shiny franc sparkled in the sunlight, catching everyone's eye.

meanings.definition: A member of a former French coinage system.
meanings.sent1: The franc was a popular coin in France many years ago.
meanings.sent2: Collectors love to find old francs to add to their collections.
meanings.sent3: Why did the franc go to school? To get smarter about money!
meanings.sent4: His ideas were like rare francs, valuable and treasured.
meanings.sent5: The ancient franc held a piece of history within its metal.
